data.title: International Calling Codes
data.meta_description: Find calling codes for every country with our international calling codes tool. Pick the country you're in and the one you're calling to and we'll do the rest.
data.meta_site_name: International Citizens Group - Resources for International Citizens and Expatriates
data.text:
How to Find the Right Calling Code for Every Country

As lifelong world travelers, we know that calling overseas can be confusing. That’s why we’ve assembled a simple international calling codes tool to help you locate the right one for every country in the world.

Just use the drop-down menu below to locate the country from which you’re making the call. Then, use the second drop-down menu to see our all country codes number list and choose the country you want to call. The tool will show you the exact numbers you need to dial to make the connection.

Below the tool, you’ll find an up-to-date list of international calling codes and time zones, as well as other tips to help you make international phone calls.

International Country Code Search, Choose:

The country you are calling from:

The country you are calling to:

You Dial:

International Access Code: + Country Code: + Local Phone Number

Tips for Making International Phone Calls

Here’s a simple guide that explains what you need to do to make an international phone call.

How to Make an International Phone Call

There are four steps to making an international phone call:

Dial your country’s international calling code (also known as an exit code)

Then dial your destination’s country code

Dial your destination’s area code

Then dial your destination’s local number

How to Make an International Call from the USA or Canada

For calls to most countries, dial 011 + country code + phone number

For calls to countries within the North American Numbering Plan, dial 1 + area code + 7 digit local number, same as dialing a US state-to-state call (note that you will incur international charges)

The Most Popular International Calling Codes

Below are some of the most frequently used international dialing codes for making overseas calls:

The USA: +1

The UK: +44

Mexico: +52

India: +91

China: +86

Read About: Top 4 Internet Options While Abroad

More Helpful Tips for Calling Abroad

In some countries, it costs more to call a mobile phone than it costs to call a landline. With this in mind, it’s important to know what type of phone you’re calling before you dial an international phone number. When possible, try to call landlines, as you’ll likely pay less.

When calling an international number with a country code that starts with 0 (zero), drop the zero before dialing the number. The zero is a “trunk code” used to make domestic calls within some countries.

The plus sign (+) used before an international telephone number can either be dialed or replaced with your country’s exit code. For example, if you are in the US and you want to call the UK number +44 7000 000 000, you can either dial the plus sign or you can replace the plus sign with 011.

Be aware of extra charges that you may incur by using a service, such as a calling card, to place international calls. These services often advertise low rates but will charge extra fees for connection or maintenance.

Global Insurance Services

If you’re planning to travel or move abroad, it’s important to make sure you have access to high-quality healthcare wherever you go. Having the right insurance coverage in place will give you peace of mind.

International Citizens Insurance is the premier provider of international health insurance plans for people of all nationalities at affordable rates.
